title: Zookeeper
data:
[![Wikipedia](/images/thumb/f/f8/Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png/50px-Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png)](/wiki/File:Fair-use-wikipedia-logo.png "Wikipedia")

[Wikipedia](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Main_Page "wikipedia:Main Page") has an article about:

***[Zookeeper](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Special:Search/Zookeeper "wikipedia:Special:Search/Zookeeper")***

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"no techniques?"*

The **Zookeeper** is a [role](/wiki/Role "Role") that first appeared in [NetHack-- 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack--_3.0.10 "NetHack-- 3.0.10"), an ancestor of [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"), and re-appears in [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM").

Zookeepers start with various items that make it easy for them to acquire and maintain [pets](/wiki/Pet "Pet").

They are lawful or neutral, and can be played as a human, elf, gnome, hobbit, kobold or giant.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Skills](#Skills)
- [2 Intrinsics](#Intrinsics)
- [3 Starting equipment](#Starting_equipment)
- [4 Rank titles](#Rank_titles)
- [5 Quest](#Quest)
- [6 Gods](#Gods)
- [7 History](#History)
- [8 References](#References)

## Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"), which predated the [skill](/wiki/Skill "Skill") system, so Zookeepers could use any weapons.

SLASHTHEM gives the Zookeeper a weapon skill set that is slightly restricted, but still broad and nuanced, and removes spell skills:

| Zookeeper skills |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |
| ---------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Max              | Skills                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| Basic            | - *Weapons:* [knife](/wiki/Knife "Knife"), [broadsword](/wiki/Broadsword "Broadsword"), [scimitar](/wiki/Scimitar "Scimitar"), [hammer](/wiki/Hammer "Hammer"), [quarterstaff](/wiki/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff"), [crossbow](/wiki/Crossbow "Crossbow"), [dart](/wiki/Dart "Dart")
- *Combat:* [two weapon combat](/wiki/Two_weapon_combat "Two weapon combat") |
| Skilled          | * *Weapons:* [club](/wiki/Club "Club"), [short sword](/wiki/Short_sword "Short sword"), [firearms](/wiki/Firearms "Firearms"), [sling](/wiki/Sling "Sling"), [unicorn horn](/wiki/Unicorn_horn "Unicorn horn"), [boomerang](/wiki/Boomerang "Boomerang")
* *Combat:* [bare hands](/wiki/Bare_hands "Bare hands"), [riding](/wiki/Riding "Riding")                |
| Expert           | - *Weapons:* [dagger](/wiki/Dagger "Dagger"), [whip](/wiki/Whip "Whip"), [spear](/wiki/Spear "Spear")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |

The Zookeeper's [special spell](/wiki/Special_spell "Special spell") is [charm monster](/wiki/Charm_monster "Charm monster"). Spell success is determined by [intelligence](/wiki/Intelligence "Intelligence").

## Intrinsics

- XL 1: [Warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning")
- XL 10: [Poison resistance](/wiki/Poison_resistance "Poison resistance")

## Starting equipment

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

*"BUC?"*

- A +1 [bullwhip](/wiki/Bullwhip "Bullwhip")
- 5 [tripe rations](/wiki/Tripe_ration "Tripe ration")
- 3 [asian pears](/wiki/Asian_pear "Asian pear")
- a [eucalyptus leaf](/wiki/Eucalyptus_leaf "Eucalyptus leaf")
- 3 [scrolls of taming](/wiki/Scroll_of_taming "Scroll of taming")
- 3 [leashes](/wiki/Leash "Leash")

The Zookeeper starts with a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet") [dingo puppy](/wiki/Dingo_puppy "Dingo puppy").

## Rank titles

The [status line](/wiki/Status_line "Status line") shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified [experience level](/wiki/Experience_level "Experience level"):

- XL 1-5: Feeder
- XL 6-13: Tamer
- XL 14-17: Trainer
- XL 18-21: Chief Tamer
- XL 22-25: Vet
- XL 26-29: Zookeeper
- XL 30: Curator

## Quest

The [quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") sees the Zookeeper fighting the [Fearful Triceratops](/index.php?title=Fearful_Triceratops\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Fearful Triceratops (page does not exist)") for the [Golden Whistle of Nora](/index.php?title=Golden_Whistle_of_Nora\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Golden Whistle of Nora (page does not exist)"), a lawful [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle") which grants [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning"), [half physical damage](/wiki/Half_physical_damage "Half physical damage"), and [ESP](/wiki/ESP "ESP"), and can be invoked for [taming](/wiki/Taming "Taming"). [Liontamer](/index.php?title=Liontamer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Liontamer (page does not exist)") is the first [sacrifice gift](/wiki/Sacrifice_gift "Sacrifice gift") for Zookeepers. It is similar to [Archaeologist quest](/wiki/Archaeologist_quest "Archaeologist quest"), but filled with [lizards](/wiki/Lizard_\(monster_class\) "Lizard (monster class)") and [zouthern animals](/wiki/Zouthern_animal "Zouthern animal"); random monster generation is biased towards [carnivorous apes](/wiki/Carnivorous_ape "Carnivorous ape"), [jaguars](/wiki/Jaguar "Jaguar") and other [felines](/wiki/Feline "Feline"), and [zouthern animals](/wiki/Zouthern_animal "Zouthern animal").

## Gods

The Zookeeper's pantheon comes from Norse mythology:

- Lawful: Balder
- Neutral: Edda
- Chaotic: Hagen

## History

The Zookeeper's first appearance was in SLASH'EM precursor NetHack-- 3.0.10 as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in [NetHack 3.0.10](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.10 "NetHack 3.0.10"). The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See [here](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J) for the relevant post.

After the release of [NetHack 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack_3.1.3 "NetHack 3.1.3") in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [NetHack-- 3.1.3](/wiki/NetHack--_3.1.3 "NetHack-- 3.1.3") by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, particularly NetHack 3.1's addition of the [Quest](/wiki/Quest "Quest") branch, the Zookeeper and other roles were simply left out of the patch to maintain compatibility.

The DAT folder for [SLASH 6](/wiki/SLASH_6 "SLASH 6") contains unused maps for quest levels for the removed roles; the Zookeeper nemesis would have been a [Y](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature") named "The Great Black Ape", and the quest artifact would have been a [magic whistle](/wiki/Magic_whistle "Magic whistle") called The Golden Whistle. The code for the maps indicates that the quest would feature numerous [felines](/wiki/Feline "Feline") and other [apelike creatures](/wiki/Apelike_creature "Apelike creature").

The Zookeeper role reappeared in the variant [Slash'EM Extended](/wiki/Slash%27EM_Extended "Slash'EM Extended") alongside the other eight new NetHack-- 3.0.10 roles, and were carried over with many tweaks into SlashTHEM, which retooled the role to more closely resemble the proposed changes above.

## References

- NetHack-- 3.0.10 attrib.c line 117
- NetHack-- 3.0.10 u\_init.c line 215
- SlashTHEM u\_init.c line 2318 in v. 0.8
- SlashTHEM role.c line 1660 in v. 0.8
- SLASHTHEM u\_init.c line 256 in v. 0.8
- SLASHTHEM artilist.h line 601 in v. 0.8
html:
Zookeeper

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Wikipedia has an article about:
Zookeeper

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"no techniques?"

The Zookeeper is a role that first appeared in NetHack-- 3.0.10, an ancestor of SLASH'EM, and re-appears in SlashTHEM.

Zookeepers start with various items that make it easy for them to acquire and maintain pets.

They are lawful or neutral, and can be played as a human, elf, gnome, hobbit, kobold or giant.

Contents

  • 1 Skills
  • 2 Intrinsics
  • 3 Starting equipment
  • 4 Rank titles
  • 5 Quest
  • 6 Gods
  • 7 History
  • 8 References

Skills

NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on NetHack 3.0.10, which predated the skill system, so Zookeepers could use any weapons.

SLASHTHEM gives the Zookeeper a weapon skill set that is slightly restricted, but still broad and nuanced, and removes spell skills:

Zookeeper skills
Max Skills
Basic
  • Weapons: knife, broadsword, scimitar, hammer, quarterstaff, crossbow, dart
  • Combat: two weapon combat
Skilled
  • Weapons: club, short sword, firearms, sling, unicorn horn, boomerang
  • Combat: bare hands, riding
Expert
  • Weapons: dagger, whip, spear

The Zookeeper's special spell is charm monster. Spell success is determined by intelligence.

Intrinsics

  • XL 1: Warning
  • XL 10: Poison resistance

Starting equipment

A user has suggested improving this page or section as follows:

"BUC?"

  • A +1 bullwhip
  • 5 tripe rations
  • 3 asian pears
  • a eucalyptus leaf
  • 3 scrolls of taming
  • 3 leashes

The Zookeeper starts with a pet dingo puppy.

Rank titles

The status line shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified experience level:

  • XL 1-5: Feeder
  • XL 6-13: Tamer
  • XL 14-17: Trainer
  • XL 18-21: Chief Tamer
  • XL 22-25: Vet
  • XL 26-29: Zookeeper
  • XL 30: Curator

Quest

The quest sees the Zookeeper fighting the Fearful Triceratops for the Golden Whistle of Nora, a lawful magic whistle which grants warning, half physical damage, and ESP, and can be invoked for taming. Liontamer is the first sacrifice gift for Zookeepers. It is similar to Archaeologist quest, but filled with lizards and zouthern animals; random monster generation is biased towards carnivorous apes, jaguars and other felines, and zouthern animals.

Gods

The Zookeeper's pantheon comes from Norse mythology:

  • Lawful: Balder
  • Neutral: Edda
  • Chaotic: Hagen

History

The Zookeeper's first appearance was in SLASH'EM precursor NetHack-- 3.0.10 as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in NetHack 3.0.10. The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See here for the relevant post.

After the release of NetHack 3.1.3 in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to NetHack-- 3.1.3 by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, particularly NetHack 3.1's addition of the Quest branch, the Zookeeper and other roles were simply left out of the patch to maintain compatibility.

The DAT folder for SLASH 6 contains unused maps for quest levels for the removed roles; the Zookeeper nemesis would have been a Y named "The Great Black Ape", and the quest artifact would have been a magic whistle called The Golden Whistle. The code for the maps indicates that the quest would feature numerous felines and other apelike creatures.

The Zookeeper role reappeared in the variant Slash'EM Extended alongside the other eight new NetHack-- 3.0.10 roles, and were carried over with many tweaks into SlashTHEM, which retooled the role to more closely resemble the proposed changes above.

References

  • NetHack-- 3.0.10 attrib.c line 117
  • NetHack-- 3.0.10 u_init.c line 215
  • SlashTHEM u_init.c line 2318 in v. 0.8
  • SlashTHEM role.c line 1660 in v. 0.8
  • SLASHTHEM u_init.c line 256 in v. 0.8
  • SLASHTHEM artilist.h line 601 in v. 0.8

The '''Zookeeper''' is a [[role]] that first appeared in [[NetHack-- 3.0.10]], an ancestor of [[SLASH'EM]], and re-appears in [[SlashTHEM]].

Zookeepers start with various items that make it easy for them to acquire and maintain [[pet]]s.

They are lawful or neutral, and can be played as a human, elf, gnome, hobbit, kobold or giant.

==Skills==
NetHack-- 3.0.10 was based on [[NetHack 3.0.10]], which predated the [[skill]] system, so Zookeepers could use any weapons.

SLASHTHEM gives the Zookeeper a weapon skill set that is slightly restricted, but still broad and nuanced, and removes spell skills:

{| class="prettytable"
! colspan="2" style="font-size:larger" | Zookeeper skills
|-
! Max !! Skills
|-
| Basic
|
* ''Weapons:'' [[knife]], [[broadsword]], [[scimitar]], [[hammer]], [[quarterstaff]], [[crossbow]], [[dart]]
* ''Combat:'' [[two weapon combat]]
|-
| Skilled
|
* ''Weapons:'' [[club]], [[short sword]], [[firearms]], [[sling]], [[unicorn horn]], [[boomerang]]
* ''Combat:'' [[bare hands]], [[riding]]
|-
| Expert
|
* ''Weapons:'' [[dagger]], [[whip]], [[spear]]
|}

The Zookeeper's [[special spell]] is [[charm monster]].  Spell success is determined by [[intelligence]].

==Intrinsics==
* XL 1: [[Warning]]
* XL 10: [[Poison resistance]]

==Starting equipment==
{{todo|BUC?}}
* A +1 [[bullwhip]]
* 5 [[tripe ration]]s
* 3 [[asian pear]]s
* a [[eucalyptus leaf]]
* 3 [[scroll of taming|scrolls of taming]]
* 3 [[leash]]es

The Zookeeper starts with a [[pet]] [[dingo puppy]].

==Rank titles==
The [[status line]] shows you to be one of the following ranks when you reach the specified [[experience level]]:

* XL 1-5: Feeder
* XL 6-13: Tamer
* XL 14-17: Trainer
* XL 18-21: Chief Tamer
* XL 22-25: Vet
* XL 26-29: Zookeeper
* XL 30: Curator

==Quest==
The [[quest]] sees the Zookeeper fighting the [[Fearful Triceratops]] for the [[Golden Whistle of Nora]], a lawful [[magic whistle]] which grants [[warning]], [[half physical damage]], and [[ESP]], and can be invoked for [[taming]]. [[Liontamer]] is the first [[sacrifice gift]] for Zookeepers.
It is similar to [[Archaeologist quest]], but filled with [[lizard (monster class)|lizards]] and [[zouthern animal]]s; random monster generation is biased towards [[carnivorous ape]]s, [[jaguar]]s and other [[feline]]s, and [[zouthern animal]]s.

==Gods==
The Zookeeper's pantheon comes from Norse mythology:

* Lawful: Balder
* Neutral: Edda
* Chaotic: Hagen

==History==
The Zookeeper's first appearance was in SLASH'EM precursor NetHack-- 3.0.10 as one of nine new roles in addition to the twelve in [[NetHack 3.0.10]]. The discussion thread in which the authors first announced the variant suggests that some of the new roles were taken from a list proposing a role for every letter of the alphabet. See [https://groups.google.com/d/msg/rec.games.hack/jg8YtQX1M3Y/tbBlteXdYY8J here] for the relevant post.

After the release of [[NetHack 3.1.3]] in 1993, NetHack-- was updated to [[NetHack-- 3.1.3]] by porting some of the changes from NetHack-- 3.0.10 into a patch for the newest version. Due to some changes in the vanilla code, however, particularly NetHack 3.1's addition of the [[Quest]] branch, the Zookeeper and other roles were simply left out of the patch to maintain compatibility.

The DAT folder for [[SLASH 6]] contains unused maps for quest levels for the removed roles; the Zookeeper nemesis would have been a {{mcsl|Y}} named "The Great Black Ape", and the quest artifact would have been a [[magic whistle]] called The Golden Whistle. The code for the maps indicates that the quest would feature numerous [[feline]]s and other [[apelike creature]]s.

The Zookeeper role reappeared in the variant [[Slash'EM Extended]] alongside the other eight new NetHack-- 3.0.10 roles, and were carried over with many tweaks into SlashTHEM, which retooled the role to more closely resemble the proposed changes above.
